text: [Music]
hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with cranberry mustard salad
dressing and I'm usually not huge on
berry vinaigrettes I'm not a big fan of
the raspberry vinaigrette
but this one is very subtle because
cranberry are very tangy I think it
makes for a really interesting
seasonally appropriate dressing so here
we go we're gonna take a couple
tablespoons of cranberry sauce this is
our famous mango kram dango but any
prepared cranberry sauce will work we're
also gonna add an equal amount of Dijon
mustard and a very small garlic clove
okay
so just a little garlic we're gonna
season that with some salt and pepper
and then for our vinegars I'm gonna go
1/2 rice vinegar and 1/2 apple cider
vinegar I so 1 vinegar on the milder
sweeter side and one vinegar on the
sharper more intense side so that's the
base of our vinaigrette we're gonna go
over to the blender and we're gonna
blend that until completely mixed and
pretty much all those cranberries are
broken down and then we're gonna start
introducing our oils and we're gonna use
two so the first one here and keeping
with the seasonal theme some roasted
walnut oil just delicious stuff so I'm
gonna drizzle in about a quarter cup of
that and of course I wanted to do the
exciting overhead drizzle in the oil
shot and then I realized my blender
hates me and it was like spitting acid
into my eyes or trying to so anyway I
drizzled this in I quickly put the lid
back on because I was just completely
splattered in vinegar alright you see
when I put myself through for you guys
anyway so while the blender is running I
drizzled in my walnut oil and then we're
gonna put in another cup or so of
regular vegetable oil or a very light
olive oil
okay so just regular canola oil is fine
I used a really light olive oil and not
an extra virgin all right you don't want
a really strong oil here something
fairly neutral and once all that
vegetable oil is drizzled in I like to
turn the blender to the highest setting
which for me was called liquify and that
really really emulsifies that oil in and
you should have something that looks
like this a thick beautiful perfectly
emulsified cranberry mustard
dressing and yes you have to be careful
pink dressings are kind of tricky all
right you don't want to look like
pepto-bismol but this one actually
doesn't it actually has kind of a cool
color I think I'm not good with colors
so to me this is pink I'm sure it has
some fancy name like mauve or something
French sounding anyway there you go a
simple easy and incredibly delicious
cranberry mustard vinaigrette perfect on
a seasonal salad like this I have my
bitter greens and dive
I have persimmons I have pistachio I
have pomegranate so good and of course
normally I would just toss this all
together but I needed a dramatic
drizzling the salad dressing shot so
that's what you got here and by the way
if you're not a great cook and you got
to bring something into that holiday
meal tell people you'll do this salad
and you're gonna bring your famous
special cranberry mustard vinaigrette so
that's a great plan people will think
you're being nice not you know lazy and
how did it taste really nice like I said
earlier I'm not a huge fan of the berry
vinaigrette they're usually too sweet
and fruity for me but this one is very
subtle it definitely has a little
fruitiness from the cranberry but that
is such a tangy fruit that it really
works here with the mustard so a great
all-purpose salad dressing any time of
the year but especially around the
holidays this would make a very cool
addition to your menu anyway I hope you
give it a try head over to food wishes
comm for all the specific ingredient
amounts as usual and as always enjoy
